title: Ticket #6180: Problems with HashTable code -- fix or use STL
description:
Besides the actual error in removing items while iterating (see #6177) there are at least some other problems with the HashTable code. For example, the HashIterator class only works if both Index and Value are pointer types, or at least can be assigned the value NULL.

Right now I have a fix for the #6170/#6177 error, but in the medium-to-long term, I think it would make more sense to switch over to using STL unordered_maps, rather than trying to re-write our HashTable code.
